block.p: Biologists at West Chester University in Pennsylvania said they had revived a bacterium, 250 million years old, that had been trapped inside a crystal of salt mined from the salt beds that house the government's plutonium waste repository in New Mexico.

This Halloween tale will be more plausible if an independent lab can confirm it. Until then skeptics may prefer a simpler explanation, that the bacterium is just a modern contaminant that escaped the biologists' attempts to sterilize the crystal.

Biologists at West Chester University in Pennsylvania said they had revived a bacterium, 250 million years old, that had been trapped inside a crystal of salt mined from the salt beds that house the government's plutonium waste repository in New Mexico.

This Halloween tale will be more plausible if an independent lab can confirm it. Until then skeptics may prefer a simpler explanation, that the bacterium is just a modern contaminant that escaped the biologists' attempts to sterilize the crystal.
In the skeptic's favor, the crystal bacterium's DNA was almost identical to a modern bacterium.
